basics.name: Poorva Satish Bedmutha
basics.label: PhD Student · Human-Centered VR Analytics
basics.summary: PhD researcher at UC San Diego designing multimodal VR analytics, physiological sensing, and wellbeing recommendation systems for neurodivergent support.

location.address: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, UC San Diego

work.name: UC San Diego Health
work.summary: Designing a recommendation API that connects students with campus wellbeing services through engagement signals and experimentation dashboards.
highlights: Built intake UX and data pipelines powering rapid prototyping of personalization strategies.
Launched A/B tests for mental health resource recommendations with campus partners.

work.name: Cosman Lab, UC San Diego
work.summary: Lead VR interview studies to analyze gaze, joint attention, and physiological cues for neurodivergent job candidates.
highlights: Developed multimodal analytics aligning gaze, head pose, and conversational flow in triadic VR interviews.
Co-authored IEEE TNSRE and ISMAR publications on immersive assessment tooling.

work.name: Qualcomm Institute · Audio Spatialization Lab
work.summary: Generated personalized HRTFs and digital avatars to evaluate acoustic realism in Space3D VR experiences.
highlights: Created ray-tracing pipelines for individualized spatial audio evaluation.
Automated avatar generation from 2D images for VR listening experiments.

volunteer.summary: Founded GradWIC mentorship circles and coordinate programming that supports graduate women and non-binary technologists across UCSD.
highlights: Onboarded 40+ mentees across three mentorship cohorts.
Organized industry panels and skills workshops with partner companies.

education.area: Electrical and Computer Engineering (Signal and Image Processing)

education.institution: Pune Institute of Computer Technology, Savitribai Phule Pune University

awards.title: Best Paper Award
awards.summary: Recognized for privacy-aware respiratory symptom detection deployed in the wild with low-sampling audio pipelines.

awards.title: Tapia Scholarship Awardee
awards.awarder: CMD-IT / ACM Richard Tapia Celebration of Diversity in Computing
awards.summary: Selected to represent UC San Diego at the Tapia Conference for contributions to inclusive computing communities.

awards.title: IEEE WISC Scholarship
awards.awarder: IEEE Women in Sensors and Communications
awards.summary: Honored for research excellence and leadership in sensing technologies.

publications.name: Analysis of Gaze, Head Orientation and Joint Attention in Autism with Triadic VR Interviews
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Neural Systems and Rehabilitation Engineering
publications.summary: Introduces multimodal analytics that align gaze, head motion, and interviewer behavior to surface support opportunities for autistic job candidates in VR.

publications.name: Privacy-Aware Respiratory Symptom Detection in-the-Wild
publications.summary: Demonstrates low-sampling audio pipelines for cough and sneeze detection that preserve privacy and run efficiently on mobile hardware.

projects.name: Triadic VR Interview Analytics
projects.summary: Created joint attention metrics and visual analytics that flag coaching opportunities for neurodivergent job candidates during VR mock interviews.
highlights: Aligned gaze, head pose, and speech cues across interviewer and candidate streams.
Released reusable tooling for Cosman Lab’s VR study cohorts.

projects.name: PulsePal Biofeedback Coach
projects.summary: Developing a conversational agent that pairs pulse oximeter feedback with generative guidance to help users self-regulate before interviews.
highlights: Combines physiological signals with language models for empathetic coaching.
Pilot testing with graduate student volunteers underway.
